
There are several tools used for online analytical processing (OLAP), including:  

- ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Mondrian
    
    An OLAP cube tool that uses MultiDimensional eXpressions (MDX) query language and translates it to SQL queries  
    
- ![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
    
    IBM Cognos Analytics
    
    A web-based tool for creating and viewing business reports, analyzing data, and making business decisions  
    
- ![](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Apache Kylin
    
    An open-source OLAP engine for big data that can provide sub-second query latency on trillions of records  
    

- ![](https://encrypted-tbn2.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTEX1tPfpzrAR5ffOVRt5R8VRzy7oc6DS5BrDv99qq0d3y6lajBDtqorQpGpMu7TpbiV6btZg)
    
    Apache Druid
    
    A tool for OLAP systems that is used for time series data ingestion, indexing, and real-time query response  
    

- ![](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSFCY2o8MCvt3GDU-vUbbCk4dyAlPTuO8JsNKQpzCYPp5MVpcB33ime&s=0)
    
    ETL tools
    
    Tools that transform source tables into cubes and store them on an OLAP server  
    

- ![](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTDOeNpSRcsvTD4Lyh7wk4TpqqqmZE9cMCl8L7vfOlbJ481Vbfflu5v&s=0)
    
    Data warehouse
    
    A tool that is often used for OLAP applications, allowing users to query and analyze large amounts of data in real time  
    

Other OLAP tools include:  

Toucan, Tableau, Adverity, Domo, Sisense, Grow, Reveal, and Microsoft Power BI.  

OLAP tools allow users to analyze data from multiple dimensions, which is known as "slicing and dicing".

Big Query works great with OLAP in that its a relational db that can operate on hundreds of terrabytes of data. Also, it's designed for large-scale processing of tabular data.
